Posts.Title: Today's Inspirational Quote CherylinOhio CherylinOhio

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2012 10:20AM kmadigan wrote: I had both stereotactic and ultrasound guided biopsies done in the same area on the same day and it really wasn't that bad.  I was very nervous going in, but they numb you up very well so you really won't feel anything.  I was a bit sore the next day but you should probably be okay for work....maybe try not to reach across that breast too much when grabbing things, but you will probably be fine to work.  Tylenol will help too.  Honestly, waiting is the most nerve-racking part, but try to remind yourself that worrying won't change the outcome, so focus all that energy on all the wonderful things you have in your life -easier said than done, I know.  Working out also really helped me when I was waiting to hear news.  Best of luck!
Posts.Title: 33 and scared Chiz34 Chiz34

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2012 08:58AM kmadigan wrote: I am a 34 year old mom of a 7 month old, and I was diagnosed Stage 3, HER2+, and PR/ER+ on Sept. 28.  I had a double mastectomy and just started AC/TH treatment 2 weeks ago.  I also was left wondering which route to go, but ultimately decided to go with the Adriamycin because there was a wider research base since it has been in use so long.  I think if you are younger and don't have any underlying heart conditions, the risks may be a bit lower.  My oncologist didn't really do the best job explaning all the details behind the debate, but I found the study done comparing the two in the Online Journal of Clinical Oncology and my second opinion oncologist did a great job explaining it.  He said both were equally good treatment options, and don't let anyone say one is the "right" way because there is no research to prove yet that one method is the superior option.  Best of luck mving forward:)
Posts.Title: and pros and cons of doing ACTH chemo vs TCH scaredycatwoman kmadigan
